thread.title: Watch Italy’s Oldest Horse Race
thread.title_full: Watch Italy’s Oldest Horse Race - Vogue

author: Gaia Squarci
title: Watch Italy’s Oldest Horse Race
text: By some accounts the oldest continuous horse race in the world, Il Palio di Siena happens twice a year in the Tuscan city of Siena. Jockeys representing different districts of the medieval city compete for little over a minute, but the rituals and celebrations last three days. Steeped in tradition and drama—and not without controversy—the 800-year-old race is now the subject of a documentary, Palio , which premiered at the 2015 Tribeca Film Festival and will have its wide release in the U.S. on November 6. Ahead of the film’s release, Gaia Squarci attended the 2015 race for Vogue.com . Here, her short film on Il Palio.
